p: Morphological changes of the ethyl acetate fraction of H. tuberosus were evaluated by light microscopic analysis, nuclear damage was assessed by PI staining, and the apoptotic inducing potential was assessed by AO/EtBr staining method. First, the biocompatible effects of different fraction of H. tuberosus were studied in noncancerous cell line of NIH-3T3 (mouse fibroblast cells). The cytotoxicity nature assay was performed by WST assay. The results of the cytotoxic activity of all the fractions showed >76% cell viability ( Figure 2a). The findings of the phase contrast microscopic images also confirm that there are no noticeable cytotoxic features ( Figure 2b).
